title: Steve Cummings' Cervélo S5 | Tour de France 2017
description:
Great Britain's National Road Racing and Time Trial Champion Steve Cummings chooses the aero Cervélo S5 for all racing stages, hardly a surprise for the man who specialises in the solo breakaway. Join us as Matt Stephens checks out the Dimension Data rider's set up for 2017.

Subscribe to GCN: http://gcn.eu/SubscribeToGCN
Get exclusive GCN gear in the GCN store! http://gcn.eu/kv

Best known for his spectacular breakaways, Cummings' Cervélo really is an aero machine. He's (rightly) proud of his historic double too, as both the GB road and TT champ, sporting Union Jack decals and the royal coat of arms. 

Matt Stephens talks us through Steve's set up with the following;

Frame and forks: Cervélo S5 
Wheels: Enve SES 4.5, Chris King hubs
Tyres: Continental Pro Limited Edition 25mm
Handlebars: Enve bladed bars 40cm
Stem: 3T 150mm
Seatpost: Cervélo Aero 
Saddle: Fizik Antares 
Shifters: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 9150
Brakes: Shimano Dura-Ace 
Front Mech: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 9150
Rear Mech: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 9150
Cranks: Rotor 2INpower
Pedals: Speedplay Zero Aero
Chainring size: 53/38 Rotor
Powermeter: Rotor 2INpower
Cassette: 11/28

Bike weight: 7.15kg
Bar width: 40cm
Stem length: 150mm 17 degree negative
Crank length: 172.5mm
Tyre width: 25mm

Finishing touches: GB decals for the National Champ.

If you'd like to contribute captions and video info in your language, here's the link

About GCN:

The Global Cycling Network puts you in the centre of the action: from the iconic climbs of Alpe D’Huez and Mont Ventoux to the cobbles of Flanders, everywhere there is road or pavé, world-class racing and pro riders, we will be there bringing you action, analysis and unparalleled access every week, every month, and every year. We show you how to be a better cyclist with our bike maintenance videos, tips for improving your cycling, cycling top tens, and not forgetting the weekly GCN Show. Join us on YouTube’s biggest and best cycling channel to get closer to the action and improve your riding!

Welcome to the Global Cycling Network | Inside cycling
